MCQ: What is the primary goal of unsupervised learning in machine learning?
Choices: a : To predict a target variable based on input features | b : To learn the underlying structure or distribution in the data in order to perform prediction or classification tasks | c : To develop a model that can classify new observations into predefined categories | d : To develop a model that can predict the continuous output variable based on one or more input variables

MCQ: Which of the following is a disadvantage of using decision trees in machine learning?
Choices: a : They are computationally expensive | b : They tend to overfit the training data | c : They require a large amount of labeled data for training | d : They are not suitable for sequential or time-series data

MCQ: What does the term 'generalization' refer to in the context of machine learning?
Choices: a : The ability of a model to accurately predict outcomes for unseen data | b : The process of reducing the size of a model to improve its efficiency | c : The ability of a model to perform well on a wide range of tasks | d : The degree to which a model is affected by slight changes in the input data

MCQ: Which algorithm is best suited for multi-class classification problems?
Choices: a : k-Nearest Neighbors | b : Logistic Regression | c : Support Vector Machines | d : Random Forest

MCQ: What is the purpose of regularization in machine learning?
Choices: a : To increase the complexity of the model | b : To prevent overfitting by adding a penalty to the loss function | c : To reduce the number of features in the model | d : To improve the interpretability of the model

MCQ: Which technique is used to evaluate the performance of a machine learning model?
Choices: a : Data augmentation | b : Cross-validation | c : Feature scaling | d : Hyperparameter tuning
